content.description: Obvious thin crack that is currently covered in moss.  Might warrant a couple of stars once the moss is removed.  Rated 5.7 on the YDS.
content.protection: Pads or toprope. Tall but good landing.
content.location: Thin seam to the right of the Teepee crack.  #5 on the beta photo

content.description: The slab to the left of the teepee cracks. Start at base of left angling arête and stay right to access an obvious sidepull rail near the top.  Rated 5.11 on the YDS.
content.protection: Pads or toprope. Tall but flat landing.
content.location: Base of obvious arête feature, climbs straight up.  #3 on the beta photo.

content.description: Two obvious cracks that form a triangle (the Teepee).  Can be started on the left or right crack at the apex continue straight up.  Rated 5.8 on the YDS.
content.protection: Pads or toprope.  Tall but good landing.
content.location: Middle of the right side of the wall, obvious triangle feature.  #4 on the beta photo.

content.description: Right most route, currently covered by a heavy layer of moss. Start at right end of the wall just left of a small left facing corner.  Rated 5.8 on the YDS.
content.protection: Pads or toprope.  Tall but good landing.
content.location: Right most route on the big wall.  #6 on the beta photo

content.description: Start at obvious small left facing corner, climb cracks and small shelves to the top.  Rated 5.8 on the YDS.
content.location: Just right of Broken Holes and left of the obvious angling line on the crag.  #2 on the beta photo.

content.description: Obvious line of broken holes and corners to the top on the far left of the wall.  Rated 5.5 on the YDS.
content.protection: Pads or toprope. Tall but good landing.
content.location: Left most route, left of the obvious angling line.  #1 on the beta photo.

content.description: An old quarry wall between the road and Goat Rock.  Currently the wall is very dirty and mossy with a nice coating of moss (see photo).  With some work, it could clean up to have a few nice low angle high ball boulder problems or short topropes.  For the routes, I have used V grades but give the Yosemite Decimal System (YDS) rating in the description if you choose to use a rope on these.
